text: The 2001 Paris–Roubaix was the 99th running of the Paris–Roubaix single-day cycling race, often known as the Hell of the North. It was held on 15 April 2001 over a distance of . These are the results for the 2001 edition of the Paris–Roubaix cycling classic, in which Servais Knaven won and Domo-Farm Frites team took all positions in the podium. ==Results== 15-04-2001: Compiègne-Roubaix, 254.5 km {| class="wikitable" style="width:45em;margin- bottom:0;" |+ Results (1–10) |- ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- !style="text- align:center"| 1 | | |align=right| 6h 45' 00" |- !style="text-align:center"| 2 | | |align=right| + 34" |- !style="text-align:center"| 3 | | |align=right| + 41" |- !style="text-align:center"| 4 | | |align=right| + 41" |- !style="text- align:center"| 5 | | |align=right| + 41" |- !style="text-align:center"| 6 | | |align=right| + 41" |- !style="text-align:center"| 7 | | |align=right| + 41" |- !style="text-align:center"| 8 | | |align=right| + 2' 35" |- !style="text- align:center"| 9 | | |align=right| + 2' 35" |- !style="text-align:center"| 10 | | |align=right| + 2' 59" |} ==References== 2001 Category:2001 in road cycling Category:2001 in French sport Paris-Rubaix Category:April 2001 sports events in Europe
